name: Hyatt Regency Montreal

reviews.text: Hyatt may not be a 5 star hotel chain but I certainly expected a lot more from this hotel. According to some reviews and the staff, the lobby was fairly recently renovated. There is a huge bar that opens up to the lobby...odd placement but it was quite modern and it looked like a nice place to have a drink. The hotel, however, should have spent a lot of the money on the elevators and room upgrades. Once you get on the elevator to go up to your room, you can truly see how old this hotel is. The elevators are loud, shaky and very hot compared to the rest of the hotel. The corridors are desinged in a very 80s/90s hotel style and the rooms are pretty average. Our room's coffee maker and fridge didn't work properly and since we had a little baby with us, it was pretty frustrating keeping milk and baby food fresh. Thankfully the staff at the Starbucks across the street were super nice and were able to give us hot water every morning for baby oatmeal.
reviews.title: Quite an average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is also very oddly placed...you have to take an elevator to the sixth floor to get to the lobby, and then of course another elevator to your room.
reviews.title: Weird layout but nice staff

reviews.text: One positive (although didn't use it myself) seemed to be the pool. It was pretty popular with all guests.
reviews.title: A pretty standard hotel made much better by helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unless you're going to the Art Gallery across the hotel, I would recommend steering away from this hotel. For the price, it's simply note good enough. Stay in Old Montreal, where smaller hotels will pay more attention to your stay.
reviews.title: Good But Missed Opportunities to be Better

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights and I have to say Bianca at the front desk was outstanding, room was basic really needs some updates, not alot to choose from at bar/restaurant @ night but if you have club pass Olga just made our stay. Hotel is easy walk to anywhere.
reviews.title: Quality Hotel, but Age Shows

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in mid July, I found the hotel to be of a high quality in public areas however the bedrooms and particularly the bathrooms are slightly dated and ready for refurbishment. I would recommend taking the upgrade to get breakfast included, as it was an excellent full buffet style affair that was good value for money. My main disappointment was the regency club lounge which was of a poor quality in comparison to other hotel lounges I have used before. The afternoon tea was a complete joke in the lounge, never before have I only been served a cookie, and had to make my own tea that was available any time anyway - someone needs to really have a rethink in my opinion. The other thing that was annoying was that children were not permitted in the lounge in the late afternoon and early evening because of the very strange licensing rules in Quebec which meant we had to take food away to be able to consume it, this would not have been so annoying if we had been warned this would be an issue before we payed the extra for the upgrade.
reviews.title: Good quality hotel in great location

reviews.text: The pool and Terence were very good and being right by the area of town where a festival was taking place outside the door was great.
reviews.title: Un excellent repos

reviews.text: All in all a good stay - Just the regency lounge that failed to deliver so I will still give it a 4 and consider it again if the price is right in the future.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We were traveling with a group of 16 other people. Everyone enjoyed their two night stay. Rooms were well-appointed and the service was impeccable. Wish we could have stayed longer. Location was central to a Humor Festival that was ongoing in mid-July. Free entertainment abounded just outside the hotel or could be enjoyed from the balcony while sipping a drink.
reviews.title: Fine

reviews.text: Having stayed here multiple times, I've found it to be consistent: relatively quiet, clean, and nice, but more about the location than anything else. We have never had a problem with our room, though, like others, we have found them to be a bit boring in design. However, they have always been clean and well maintained, and I believe the whole hotel was recently updated.
reviews.title: Very good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the public areas have been redecorated in a very stylish manner, the rooms are extremely small and leave a lot to be desired. The Regency Club is on the ground floor (?) and charges for beer and wine, which is odd to say the least. The double elevator situation is weird - as other guest have noted. And the rooms are small and in need of an update - e.g. peeling wallpaper, outdated furniture, ceramic tiled bathrooms, etc. As a Diamond, the front desk advised I had been upgraded, but honestly, I couldn't tell if that was true or not. At best my room was 300 sf. and drab, to say the least.
reviews.title: Not my favorite Hyatt property...

reviews.text: My husband and I arrived to the Hyatt Regency after a long drive from Toronto. At the time, it was a bit hard to find where to park at the hotel because there was a lot of construction going on. We got to the front desk and were served fairly quickly...got our key cards and headed upstairs to our room. The room had one king bed, and it was very clean. I have allergies, so I was very happy that they also had a hypoallergenic pillow already in the room that wasn't stuffed with duck feathers! The view from the room would've been better without all of the construction, but that's not the hotel's problem. It was close enough for us to walk into Old Montreal which is one thing we had planned on doing. There were lots of shops around as well, so we had no trouble finding spots to eat. Parking was quite a bit expensive, and we had to pay each time we left and came back to the hotel. It would've been nice to have an option of buying a parking pass to last for the entire stay. All in all, we had a nice stay and will consider staying here again the next time we travel to Montreal.
reviews.title: Pleasant anniversary stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While this is well located for central Montreal the internal decoration/state of rooms and corridors is somewhat depressing - tired browns and fawns everywhere.
reviews.title: Drab

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were only staying for one night and it was great to have the life of the jazz festival right outside.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are some local eating places nearby but the old town is probably agood 20 minute walk.
reviews.title: Annoyed!

reviews.text: Went to festival juste pour rire need a place close by. The Hyatt was the place right downtown Montreal near, place des spectacles , where evrything happen close to restaurant over, place Desjardins, shopping mall no need to go out, walking distance to many attractive place. Place to be.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: Freindly staff, clean.
reviews.title: Best Location

reviews.text: I spent three nights at the Hyatt the last week of June. The hotel is the very best location in the city even though the rooms were small. We were right next to the Jazz Festival, museums, restaurants, and a short walk to Old Montreal. Public transportation was really close. The elevators in the hotel were oddly configured but you finally get it figured out. I was really annoyed with the outrageous charge for the internet. There is a Starbucks directly across from the hotel with free wifi access. Did not take any meals in the hotel, but several meals in Eggspectations Restaurant right out the front door of the hotel. Overall a good experience.

I stayed solo at the Hyatt Regency in Montreal for one night and I had the best Hotel experience ever. I travel a lot and I have stayed in many hotels, but the customer service here was the best one I have ever received. I couldn't find location on St-Catherine street, so the gentleman working at the Exit walked me there!! Also, the receptionist at the Lobby was extremely helpful and nice. She booked me a room with the prettiest view. The lobby/hallways smelled very nice and looked modern and chic.
reviews.title: Great location
Fantastic location and pool
reviews.text: To be honest, I do not have one negative review of this hotel. Amazing staff, location, service, rooms... Will DEFINITELY be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at the Hyatt Regency in Montreal in mid-September, while in town for a friend's birthday. Overall, the ideal location and great city views made for a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Nice Euro style hotel, perfectly placed in Centre-Ville
Dreary place, but great staff
reviews.text: As others have noted, the hotel has a somewhat odd physical plant, with a shuttle elevator from street level to the lobby (with two slow-moving cabs that smelled of hot electricals and machine oil). Not ideal, but not really a problem, either. The lobby itself has been pleasantly redone and is spacious in a low-ceilinged 1980s sort of way.

Our room was on the fourth floor overlooking the Place des Arts, an open plaza at the heart of Montreal's festival district, with fountains, a contemporary art museum and performance spaces. It's pretty spectacular, as its name suggests. The view was great. As others have said, the room was well appointed but a bit careworn and showing some signs of deferred maintenance. It was, however, roomy and comfortable, and quite quiet, even though our particular room was close to the elevator lobby.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing odd: the hallways smelled slightly of stale and fresh cigarette smoke (though I think it was a non-smoking floor-- tinged with (of all things) the sent of cucumber. Strange. Our room was fine, however.
reviews.title: As expected & did not disappoint!

reviews.text: Best of all things about the Hyatt, of course, its central location... Maybe ten walking minutes from the McGill campus and Chinatown, and 15 minutes from Vieux Montreal. Our weekend package included valet parking, which made coming and going very easy. It's a great way to enjoy all that Montreal has to offer.
reviews.title: central hotel

reviews.text: Perfectly and centerally located to almost all major sites, this hotel offers the family and business traveller the best of service and location. Located right on teh Place des Arts, it is easy access to Old Town Montreal (the port), the Latin Quartera, Chinatown,and many other sites nearby. I was just there for the Montreal World Film Festival which was also the festival HQ: in a very busy time, staff always remained helpful, kind and friendly. Except for the wine lounge that provided very high prices for average wine where you get only half a cup for $12 or more, my recomendation is to purchase your own bottle outside the hotel.
reviews.title: Location, location, location + service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful and is located within walking distance from many fantastic attractions, shopping, Montreal convention center, etc. The front desk staff was so lovely and helpful and our room was exceptional. There is also a great bar/lounge in the lobby!
reviews.title: First class all the way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here during the Jazz fest and it made everything easy. The location is right outside the festival entrance and in walking distance to many of the great things Montreal has to offer. The room was clean and comfortable. Hotel staff was always helpful and friendly. In house parking was conveinient and easy to deal with.
reviews.title: In the middle of it!

reviews.text: We attended on Labor Day weekend, which is very busy here. The hotel is located in a mall complex and walking distance from Notre Dame Cathedral and China Town. The lobby and bar area is modern. Our room was on the fourth floor with a scenic view of the roof. The AC needed to be set at 67 degrees to keep it comfortable. Towels are thin. There are refrigerators and small safes in the rooms. Wifi is $9.95 extra per day normally, but they were having a promotion this weekend. Our 7am wake up never arrived, and when I complained, nothing was offered. This must be the norm, as it happened to a fried of ours also. Rooms need updating, and the corridor smells of cigarette smoke.
reviews.title: Not impressed.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I asked to extend one day and the rate jumped 50%. Needless to say, we booked at the Travel lodge for $100 less, across the street....and they have a free breakfast and wifi!
reviews.title: Well located

reviews.text: I stayed at the HR Montreal for 4 nights in July 2013. Check-in was easy, once you made it to the front desk. You have to take an elevator ride up 3 or 6 floors, depending on where you enter the property to get to the front desk. The weather was hot and humid, so I blasted the A/C when I got to my room...or so I thought. My thermostat was on 60 the entire time, and never felt cooler than 73-74 degrees in that room. We called maintenance, and they said the unit was working, but becacuse it was so hot and everyone in the hotel was overtaxing the units, it wasn't getting any cooler. This was not good news to a Texan who lives and dies by a working A/C unit. The room wasn't brand new, but it was fine. A few improvements could be made; reinforcement/replacement of molding in the bathroom, etc., but nothing to really complain about. The housekeeping service was great. Breakfast was good; plenty of choices. We ordered room service once...$45 for wings fries and a Pepsi. Yep, we were THAT hungry and it was THAT late. Good food, but not $45 good. The gym is small, so you have to get there really early to secure one of the 2 elliptical trainers or 4 treadmills. Otherwise, you have to wait for the early-AM gym folk to leave. Two of the 4 elevator banks had issues during our stay, so the elevators were impossible when there was a dinner/gala event for the confrence. You can't just walk down 5 flighhts of stairs if you want to avoid waiting for the elevator. There are "dummy" or "extra" floors you have to descend...so, if you're on the 5th floor, you actually have to wak down 8 or 9 flights to get to the lobby. Quite weird, but so was riding up 6 floors from the street to get to the lobby.
reviews.title: Conference Stay - Pricey, Adequate

reviews.text: The tunnel system provided easy acces to the convention center, which was convenient on rainy days. We could/hear see most of the jazz fest activities from our room, which was cool. Overall good hotel for conference stay. Not FABULOUS, but good. Please be kind to the housekeeping staff; they're really nice and apparently don't get much politeness from guests.
reviews.title: Ok hotel, but stayed in better

reviews.text: I spent three nights here last month. The hotel is located in the city center, about 10-12 mins walk from Old Montreal. From Trudeau airport, you can take the 747 bus to the 7th stop and walk 1 block north. This took me about 35 mins (no traffic) but I imagine at peak times probably takes well over an hour. The hotel is attached to a shopping mall (bonus!) and is right in the middle of the city.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entrance to the hotel is very awkward, as only a small sign is present. (This may be due to construction but I am not sure.). You have to take two sets of elevators up to the lobby. While this is no big deal, they can be slow and crowded at peak times. Sometimes I wished a stairwell was nearby so I could avoid the wait.
reviews.title: Not worth the price paid

reviews.text: My room itself was ok. Clean and comfortable, but not much more. Nothing great but not like some people who mention peeling paint etc. I would say average room. My one issue was the my in room wifi signal was terrible. Since I was part of a large group this was free of charge, but had I been paying for it, that would have been unacceptable.
reviews.title: So Disappointed!

reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Clean, well appointed, just what you'd expect from the Hyatt. There are three drawbacks about this hotel. There is no free wifi anywhere in the hotel. It costs $15/day, but starbucks is right across the street with free wifi. Also to get to the guests rooms from outside you have to take 2 separate sets of elevators and it sometimes takes a while. Lastly, if you have small children and they want to go in the pool you are required to go in the water with them, even if they can swim.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.text: What a joy it is to finally stay at a hotel that got it all right and where *all* of the staff - from the porters, to the receptionists, the concierge, the restaurant staff, and the housekeepers - were competent, attentive, polite and helpful. I spent a very pleasant week at the Hyatt, having complete peace of mind throughout my stay at the hotel, which gave me the ability to focus 100% on what I was there for. Will surely try to stay here again the next time that I am in Montreal.
reviews.title: Enjoyed every part of my stay

reviews.text: Loved this hotel. Greeted by very friendly bellmen/valet; front desk attendants were very courteous and helpful. Housekeeping answered every request very promptly (extra towels, coffee, etc.) On departure day, everything ran smoothly. Would stay again.
reviews.title: First visit to Canada - Hyatt Montreal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for the long Labor Day holiday and it was a pleasant stay. The location of the hotel is phenomenal and the cost is quite affordable given were you are in the city and that most things are within walking distance.
reviews.title: Quick weekend in Montreal

reviews.text: The rooms seems to be recently updated and they are clean, but we had two slight issues:
reviews.title: This hotel cannot be 4 stars, bad service

description: Few Montreal hotels offer direct underground access to the Montreal Convention Centre, the Metro and the Contemporary Museum of Art. Our Montreal hotel is also within walking distance of Old Montreal, Chinatown and the trendiest restaurants. Our hotel features 605 handsomely appointed guest rooms and suites with spectacular views of our dynamic city.
